TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks Handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentCompleted?displayProperty=nameWithType> event to receive notification when the new document finishes loading. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventArgs> object passed to the event handler lets you retrieve the location of the new document through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventArgs.Url%2A> property. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentCompleted?displayProperty=nameWithType> event occurs, the new document is fully loaded, which means you can access its contents through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.Document%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentText%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentStream%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this type. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentCompleted> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> named `WebBrowser1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentCompleted> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#645](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#645)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#645](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#645)]

Docs.summary: Gets the location of the document to which the control has navigated.
Docs.value: A representing the location of the document that was loaded.
